etymology.description: 情(情) (qíng, "emotions; feelings") 變(變) (biàn, "change; transform")
etymology.interpretation: The word 情變 (qíngbiàn) refers to a change or transformation in emotions or relationships, particularly in the context of a romantic breakup. The combination of 情(情) (qíng, "emotions; feelings") and 變(變) (biàn, "change; transform") emphasizes an alteration in the emotional state or circumstances of a relationship.

examples.chinese: 他们之间情变(他們之間情變)。
这段婚姻曾经幸福(這段婚姻曾經幸福)，如今却因情变而终止(如今日卻因情變而終止)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè duàn hūnyīn céngjīng xìngfú, rújīn què yīn qíngbiàn ér zhōngzhǐ.
examples.english: This marriage was once happy, but now it has ended due to a breakup.

examples.chinese: 他们因矛盾累积情变(他們因矛盾累積情變)，最终各奔东西(最終各奔東西)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yīn máodùn lěijī qíngbiàn, zuìzhōng gè bèn dōngxī.
examples.english: They broke up due to accumulating conflicts and eventually went their separate ways.
